definition: work and rest
to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)
to escape/leisurely/outstanding
to strike a balance between work and rest (idiom)

sentences.english: School curriculum should be reasonable, do students work and rest.
sentences.chinese: 学校应该合理地课改，做到让学生劳逸结合。

sentences.english: Athletes understand that effective training comes from a combination of exercise and rest.
sentences.chinese: 运动员明白有效的训练要劳逸结合。

sentences.english: They may actually get more toil out of you.
sentences.chinese: 但是，劳逸结合也许会让你更加辛苦。

sentences.english: Only through reconciling work and rest can we improve efficiency.
sentences.chinese: 劳逸结合才能提高工作效率。

sentences.english: Has the time amusement, although said alternates work with rest, but works in where?
sentences.chinese: 有时间玩乐，虽然说劳逸结合，但是劳动在何处？

sentences.english: Next, must avoid overtiredly, the attention alternates work with rest.
sentences.chinese: 其次，要避免过度疲劳，注意劳逸结合。

sentences.english: Our today's terms, is the meaning of combining exertion and rest.
sentences.chinese: 拿我们今天的话来说，就是劳逸结合的意思。

sentences.english: Note physical exercise, combining exertion, to take part in physical activities.
sentences.chinese: 注意锻炼身体，劳逸结合，多参加体育活动。

sentences.english: To keep healthy, every one of us should work and rest.
sentences.chinese: 为了保持健康，我们每个人都应劳逸结合。

definition: to strike a balance between work and rest (idiom)
to nurse to health/to recuperate
physical exercise
to work and rest
lit. rising and lying down, working and resting (idiom)/fig. everyday life/daily routine/to go about one's daily life
early to bed, early to rise/to keep early hours
exhausted/worn out
daily schedule/daily routine
food and drink/diet
deficiency of kidney essence due to sexual excess (TCM)
going with nature and the seasons (TCM)
slight or important, urgent or non-urgent (idiom); to deal with important matters first/sense of priority/also written 輕重緩急|轻重缓急
overwork
to adapt (to an environment etc)/to make sth suitable/adaptation/adjustment/adaptive
emotion/mood
lit. the body is the revolution's capital/fig. good health is a prerequisite for work (Mao Zedong's saying)
pinyin: shen1 ti3 shi4 ge2 ming4 de5 ben3 qian2
